25#include "hb.hh"
26
27/* This file is a straight port of the following:
28 *
29 * https://github.com/fonttools/fonttools/blob/f73220816264fc383b8a75f2146e8d69e455d398/Lib/fontTools/varLib/instancer/solver.py
30 *
31 * Where that file returns None for a triple, we return Triple{}.
32 * This should be safe.
33 */
34
35constexpr static float EPSILON = 1.f / (1 << 14);
36constexpr static float MAX_F2DOT14 = float (0x7FFF) / (1 << 14);
37
38struct Triple {
39
40 Triple () :
41 minimum (0.f), middle (0.f), maximum (0.f) {}
42
43 Triple (float minimum_, float middle_, float maximum_) :
44 minimum (minimum_), middle (middle_), maximum (maximum_) {}
45
46 bool operator == (const Triple &o) const
47 {
48 return minimum == o.minimum &&
49 middle == o.middle &&
50 maximum == o.maximum;
51 }
52
53 float minimum;
54 float middle;
55 float maximum;
56};
57
58static inline Triple _reverse_negate(const Triple &v)
59{ return {-v.maximum, -v.middle, -v.minimum}; }
60
61
62static inline float supportScalar (float coord, const Triple &tent)
63{
64 /* Copied from VarRegionAxis::evaluate() */
65 float start = tent.minimum, peak = tent.middle, end = tent.maximum;
66
67 if (unlikely (start > peak || peak > end))
68 return 1.;
69 if (unlikely (start < 0 && end > 0 && peak != 0))
70 return 1.;
71
72 if (peak == 0 || coord == peak)
73 return 1.;
74
75 if (coord <= start || end <= coord)
76 return 0.;
77
78 /* Interpolate */
79 if (coord < peak)
80 return (coord - start) / (peak - start);
81 else
82 return (end - coord) / (end - peak);
83}
84
85
86using result_item_t = hb_pair_t<float, Triple>;
87using result_t = hb_vector_t<result_item_t>;
88
89static inline result_t
90_solve (Triple tent, Triple axisLimit, bool negative = false)
91{
92 float axisMin = axisLimit.minimum;
93 float axisDef = axisLimit.middle;
94 float axisMax = axisLimit.maximum;
95 float lower = tent.minimum;
96 float peak = tent.middle;
97 float upper = tent.maximum;
98
99 // Mirror the problem such that axisDef <= peak
100 if (axisDef > peak)
101 {
102 result_t vec = _solve (tent: _reverse_negate (v: tent),
103 axisLimit: _reverse_negate (v: axisLimit),
104 negative: !negative);
105
106 for (auto &p : vec)
107 p = hb_pair (a&: p.first, b: _reverse_negate (v: p.second));
108
109 return vec;
110 }
111 // axisDef <= peak
112
113 /* case 1: The whole deltaset falls outside the new limit; we can drop it
114 *
115 * peak
116 * 1.........................................o..........
117 * / \
118 * / \
119 * / \
120 * / \
121 * 0---|-----------|----------|-------- o o----1
122 * axisMin axisDef axisMax lower upper
123 */
124 if (axisMax <= lower && axisMax < peak)
125 return result_t{}; // No overlap
126
127 /* case 2: Only the peak and outermost bound fall outside the new limit;
128 * we keep the deltaset, update peak and outermost bound and and scale deltas
129 * by the scalar value for the restricted axis at the new limit, and solve
130 * recursively.
131 *
132 * |peak
133 * 1...............................|.o..........
134 * |/ \
135 * / \
136 * /| \
137 * / | \
138 * 0--------------------------- o | o----1
139 * lower | upper
140 * |
141 * axisMax
142 *
143 * Convert to:
144 *
145 * 1............................................
146 * |
147 * o peak
148 * /|
149 * /x|
150 * 0--------------------------- o o upper ----1
151 * lower |
152 * |
153 * axisMax
154 */
155 if (axisMax < peak)
156 {
157 float mult = supportScalar (coord: axisMax, tent);
158 tent = Triple{lower, axisMax, axisMax};
159
160 result_t vec = _solve (tent, axisLimit);
161
162 for (auto &p : vec)
163 p = hb_pair (a: p.first * mult, b&: p.second);
164
165 return vec;
166 }
167
168 // lower <= axisDef <= peak <= axisMax
169
170 float gain = supportScalar (coord: axisDef, tent);
171 result_t out {hb_pair (a&: gain, b: Triple{})};
172
173 // First, the positive side
174
175 // outGain is the scalar of axisMax at the tent.
176 float outGain = supportScalar (coord: axisMax, tent);
177
178 /* Case 3a: Gain is more than outGain. The tent down-slope crosses
179 * the axis into negative. We have to split it into multiples.
180 *
181 * | peak |
182 * 1...................|.o.....|..............
183 * |/x\_ |
184 * gain................+....+_.|..............
185 * /| |y\|
186 * ................../.|....|..+_......outGain
187 * / | | | \
188 * 0---|-----------o | | | o----------1
189 * axisMin lower | | | upper
190 * | | |
191 * axisDef | axisMax
192 * |
193 * crossing
194 */
195 if (gain > outGain)
196 {
197 // Crossing point on the axis.
198 float crossing = peak + ((1 - gain) * (upper - peak) / (1 - outGain));
199
200 Triple loc{peak, peak, crossing};
201 float scalar = 1.f;
202
203 // The part before the crossing point.
204 out.push (v: hb_pair (a: scalar - gain, b&: loc));
205
206 /* The part after the crossing point may use one or two tents,
207 * depending on whether upper is before axisMax or not, in one
208 * case we need to keep it down to eternity.
209 *
210 * Case 3a1, similar to case 1neg; just one tent needed, as in
211 * the drawing above.
212 */
213 if (upper >= axisMax)
214 {
215 Triple loc {crossing, axisMax, axisMax};
216 float scalar = supportScalar (coord: axisMax, tent);
217
218 out.push (v: hb_pair (a: scalar - gain, b&: loc));
219 }
220
221 /* Case 3a2: Similar to case 2neg; two tents needed, to keep
222 * down to eternity.
223 *
224 * | peak |
225 * 1...................|.o................|...
226 * |/ \_ |
227 * gain................+....+_............|...
228 * /| | \xxxxxxxxxxy|
229 * / | | \_xxxxxyyyy|
230 * / | | \xxyyyyyy|
231 * 0---|-----------o | | o-------|--1
232 * axisMin lower | | upper |
233 * | | |
234 * axisDef | axisMax
235 * |
236 * crossing
237 */
238 else
239 {
240 // A tent's peak cannot fall on axis default. Nudge it.
241 if (upper == axisDef)
242 upper += EPSILON;
243
244 // Downslope.
245 Triple loc1 {crossing, upper, axisMax};
246 float scalar1 = 0.f;
247
248 // Eternity justify.
249 Triple loc2 {upper, axisMax, axisMax};
250 float scalar2 = 1.f; // supportScalar({"tag": axisMax}, {"tag": tent})
251
252 out.push (v: hb_pair (a: scalar1 - gain, b&: loc1));
253 out.push (v: hb_pair (a: scalar2 - gain, b&: loc2));
254 }
255 }
256
257 /* Case 3: Outermost limit still fits within F2Dot14 bounds;
258 * we keep deltas as is and only scale the axes bounds. Deltas beyond -1.0
259 * or +1.0 will never be applied as implementations must clamp to that range.
260 *
261 * A second tent is needed for cases when gain is positive, though we add it
262 * unconditionally and it will be dropped because scalar ends up 0.
263 *
264 * TODO: See if we can just move upper closer to adjust the slope, instead of
265 * second tent.
266 *
267 * | peak |
268 * 1.........|............o...|..................
269 * | /x\ |
270 * | /xxx\ |
271 * | /xxxxx\|
272 * | /xxxxxxx+
273 * | /xxxxxxxx|\
274 * 0---|-----|------oxxxxxxxxx|xo---------------1
275 * axisMin | lower | upper
276 * | |
277 * axisDef axisMax
278 */
279 else if (axisDef + (axisMax - axisDef) * 2 >= upper)
280 {
281 if (!negative && axisDef + (axisMax - axisDef) * MAX_F2DOT14 < upper)
282 {
283 // we clamp +2.0 to the max F2Dot14 (~1.99994) for convenience
284 upper = axisDef + (axisMax - axisDef) * MAX_F2DOT14;
285 assert (peak < upper);
286 }
287
288 // Special-case if peak is at axisMax.
289 if (axisMax == peak)
290 upper = peak;
291
292 Triple loc1 {hb_max (axisDef, lower), peak, upper};
293 float scalar1 = 1.f;
294
295 Triple loc2 {peak, upper, upper};
296 float scalar2 = 0.f;
297
298 // Don't add a dirac delta!
299 if (axisDef < upper)
300 out.push (v: hb_pair (a: scalar1 - gain, b&: loc1));
301 if (peak < upper)
302 out.push (v: hb_pair (a: scalar2 - gain, b&: loc2));
303 }
304
305 /* Case 4: New limit doesn't fit; we need to chop into two tents,
306 * because the shape of a triangle with part of one side cut off
307 * cannot be represented as a triangle itself.
308 *
309 * | peak |
310 * 1.........|......o.|...................
311 * | /x\|
312 * | |xxy|\_
313 * | /xxxy| \_
314 * | |xxxxy| \_
315 * | /xxxxy| \_
316 * 0---|-----|-oxxxxxx| o----------1
317 * axisMin | lower | upper
318 * | |
319 * axisDef axisMax
320 */
321 else
322 {
323 Triple loc1 {hb_max (axisDef, lower), peak, axisMax};
324 float scalar1 = 1.f;
325
326 Triple loc2 {peak, axisMax, axisMax};
327 float scalar2 = supportScalar (coord: axisMax, tent);
328
329 out.push (v: hb_pair (a: scalar1 - gain, b&: loc1));
330 // Don't add a dirac delta!
331 if (peak < axisMax)
332 out.push (v: hb_pair (a: scalar2 - gain, b&: loc2));
333 }
334
335 /* Now, the negative side
336 *
337 * Case 1neg: Lower extends beyond axisMin: we chop. Simple.
338 *
339 * | |peak
340 * 1..................|...|.o.................
341 * | |/ \
342 * gain...............|...+...\...............
343 * |x_/| \
344 * |/ | \
345 * _/| | \
346 * 0---------------o | | o----------1
347 * lower | | upper
348 * | |
349 * axisMin axisDef
350 */
351 if (lower <= axisMin)
352 {
353 Triple loc {axisMin, axisMin, axisDef};
354 float scalar = supportScalar (coord: axisMin, tent);
355
356 out.push (v: hb_pair (a: scalar - gain, b&: loc));
357 }
358
359 /* Case 2neg: Lower is betwen axisMin and axisDef: we add two
360 * tents to keep it down all the way to eternity.
361 *
362 * | |peak
363 * 1...|...............|.o.................
364 * | |/ \
365 * gain|...............+...\...............
366 * |yxxxxxxxxxxxxx/| \
367 * |yyyyyyxxxxxxx/ | \
368 * |yyyyyyyyyyyx/ | \
369 * 0---|-----------o | o----------1
370 * axisMin lower | upper
371 * |
372 * axisDef
373 */
374 else
375 {
376 // A tent's peak cannot fall on axis default. Nudge it.
377 if (lower == axisDef)
378 lower -= EPSILON;
379
380 // Downslope.
381 Triple loc1 {axisMin, lower, axisDef};
382 float scalar1 = 0.f;
383
384 // Eternity justify.
385 Triple loc2 {axisMin, axisMin, lower};
386 float scalar2 = 0.f;
387
388 out.push (v: hb_pair (a: scalar1 - gain, b&: loc1));
389 out.push (v: hb_pair (a: scalar2 - gain, b&: loc2));
390 }
391
392 return out;
393}
394
395/* Normalizes value based on a min/default/max triple. */
396static inline float normalizeValue (float v, const Triple &triple, bool extrapolate = false)
397{
398 /*
399 >>> normalizeValue(400, (100, 400, 900))
400 0.0
401 >>> normalizeValue(100, (100, 400, 900))
402 -1.0
403 >>> normalizeValue(650, (100, 400, 900))
404 0.5
405 */
406 float lower = triple.minimum, def = triple.middle, upper = triple.maximum;
407 assert (lower <= def && def <= upper);
408
409 if (!extrapolate)
410 v = hb_max (hb_min (v, upper), lower);
411
412 if ((v == def) || (lower == upper))
413 return 0.f;
414
415 if ((v < def && lower != def) || (v > def && upper == def))
416 return (v - def) / (def - lower);
417 else
418 {
419 assert ((v > def && upper != def) ||
420 (v < def && lower == def));
421 return (v - def) / (upper - def);
422 }
423}
424
425/* Given a tuple (lower,peak,upper) "tent" and new axis limits
426 * (axisMin,axisDefault,axisMax), solves how to represent the tent
427 * under the new axis configuration. All values are in normalized
428 * -1,0,+1 coordinate system. Tent values can be outside this range.
429 *
430 * Return value: a list of tuples. Each tuple is of the form
431 * (scalar,tent), where scalar is a multipler to multiply any
432 * delta-sets by, and tent is a new tent for that output delta-set.
433 * If tent value is Triple{}, that is a special deltaset that should
434 * be always-enabled (called "gain").
435 */
436HB_INTERNAL result_t rebase_tent (Triple tent, Triple axisLimit);
437
438result_t
439rebase_tent (Triple tent, Triple axisLimit)
440{
441 assert (-1.f <= axisLimit.minimum && axisLimit.minimum <= axisLimit.middle && axisLimit.middle <= axisLimit.maximum && axisLimit.maximum <= +1.f);
442 assert (-2.f <= tent.minimum && tent.minimum <= tent.middle && tent.middle <= tent.maximum && tent.maximum <= +2.f);
443 assert (tent.middle != 0.f);
444
445 result_t sols = _solve (tent, axisLimit);
446
447 auto n = [&axisLimit] (float v) { return normalizeValue (v, triple: axisLimit, extrapolate: true); };
448
449 result_t out;
450 for (auto &p : sols)
451 {
452 if (!p.first) continue;
453 if (p.second == Triple{})
454 {
455 out.push (v&: p);
456 continue;
457 }
458 Triple t = p.second;
459 out.push (v: hb_pair (a&: p.first,
460 b: Triple{n (t.minimum), n (t.middle), n (t.maximum)}));
461 }
462
463 return sols;
464}
